results.title: Second life
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Ximena Silberman and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ximena migrated to Australia in 2003. To migrate is to be born again. While enjoying her new life in Australia, she looks back at the friendships and life she left behind in Buenos Aires. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Jewish Museum of Australia

results.title: Second chorus
results.creator_credit: Boris Morros, Paramount Pictures and H C Potter
results.brief_description: Fred Astaire leads a University orchestra and plays the trumpet while aspiring to great heights. Danny, and his friend and rival, Hank Taylor, vie for Ellen’s affections and a position with the famous Artie Shaw Band. Romance and comedy abound as the beautiful and witty Paulette Godard endeavours to influence her boss, Artie Shaw, into recruiting the talented duo.

results.title: Sebastiane
results.creator_credit: Disctac London, James Whaley, Howard Malin, Derek Jarman and Paul Humfress
results.brief_description: This film is a profane version of the martyrdom of Sebastian who, in AD 303, was banished by the Emperor Diocletian for his Christian sympathies to a remote outpost of the Roman Legion. The legend of Catholic mythology is here transformed into a psychological exploration of male sexuality with Sebastian as a homosexual icon. Jarman’s film was an innovative independent production for British cinema, its most unusual feature being its dialogue which is in Latin, thus avoiding the anachronisms and banalities of the dialogue in most historical films and the problems of deploying a multinational cast. The film was shot in just over three weeks in semi-improvisatory fashion. There is a subtext of Latin jokes and contemporary references. Cast includes Leonardo Treviglio, Barney James, Neil Kennedy and Richard Warwick. In Latin with English subtitles.

results.title: Sebastian the fox: the sleepwalkers
results.creator_credit: Patrick Ryan, Eltham Films and Tim Burstall
results.brief_description: Puppet film featuring Sebastian Fox up to his cunning tricks again - disturbing the sleep of two grown-ups. He pulls off the bed-clothes, then frightens them by appearing as a ghost. Finally, Sebastian locks out the couple and takes over the bed. Puppets by Peter Scriven.

results.title: Sebastian the fox: the painter
results.creator_credit: Patrick Ryan, Eltham Films and Tim Burstall
results.brief_description: Sebastian the Fox enters an artist’s studio and does some painting himself, while the artist and his model are having tea. He is made to clear up the mess he makes and told to leave, but Sebastian has his revenge. Photography by Giorgio Manianele.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patrick Ryan, Eltham Films and Tim Burstall

results.title: Sebastian the fox: the goldmine
results.creator_credit: Patrick Ryan, Eltham Films and Tim Burstall
results.brief_description: Using a combination of live actors and a puppet - “Sebastian the Fox” - this film tells how two unscrupulous miners sell a supposedly worthless mine to Sebastian for 5 Pounds. Sebastian promptly unearths a nugget; the miners try to steal it. Sebastian, however, “outfoxes” them and the rascally pair are left with an old boot as the fox drives off with the nugget. No dialogue spoken. Credits include: writing by Tim Burstall; photography by Giorgio Mangiamele; editing by Alan Harkness and Michael Thornhill; music by George Dreyfus.

results.title: Sebastian the fox: the burglar
results.creator_credit: Patrick Ryan, Eltham Films and Tim Burstall
results.brief_description: Puppet film for children. Sebastian the Fox, caught in the rain, seeks refuge in a warm house. A burglar later enters the same house and disturbs the occupant. She mistakes Sebastian for the intruder, but he then catches the real burglar, and is suitably rewarded.

results.title: Sebastian the fox: the animal catcher
results.brief_description: Another adventure for Sebastian the Fox when he is caught by Professor Catchem, licensed animal catcher and pet shop owner. A young boy decides to buy Sebastian when he sees him in the display window, but Sebastian is too clever and outsmarts the boy and the professor. Puppets by Peter Scriven. Music by George Dreyfus.

results.title: Sebastian and the sparrow
results.creator_credit: Kino Film Company and Scott Hicks
results.brief_description: 15 year old Sebastian thinks that he is hard done by. He has reached a feeling of boredom with his predictable middle class existence. He learns what hardship is really about when he encounters Sparrow at the local video parlour. Sparrow has more tougher trials to face, such as sleeping in clothing bins, scavenging for food and protecting himself from skinheads and the law. An uplifting story about how friendship can transcend social and economic boundaries. Starring Alexander Bainbridge, Jeremy Angerson and Elizabeth Alexander.
